creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Marilyn Tupper Doe
description: night scene: street lined with buildings and yellow glowing lanterns; towering spire with mass of yellow glowing lanterns at center; crowds of men in Western dress, and women in kimono along street, mostly silhouetted against lights
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Twelve Months of Kyoto 京名勝十二月
title: July (Gorgeous procession of "Yama-hoko" or the floats at the Gion festival)
